results.title: Successful camerawork for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.

results.title: Subway [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Francois Ruggieri, Gaumont-British Instructional, Les Films du Loup, TFI Films and TSF Production
results.brief_description: This strange combination of action, comedy, violence and suspense tells the story of a cool rebel on the run, who uses the dark tunnels of the Paris subway as his hideout. There he meets a wide assortment of unusual characters. Stars Christopher Lambert and Isabelle Adjani. The soundtrack has been dubbed into English.

results.title: Subtended arc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”
Two straight lines intersecting at a fixed angle are made to slide on the extremities of a fixed straight line; the point of intersection traces out a complete circle.

results.title: Student nurse
results.creator_credit: Francis Searle and Gaumont-British Screen Services
results.brief_description: The story of a trainee nurse in Great Britain, from the time she is a probationer in a training hospital until the time she is a fully-qualified State-registered nurse. In hospital wards, laboratories, operating theatres, and lecture-rooms, she acquires during her years of training technical knowledge and practical skills.

results.title: Struggle for Pedder
results.brief_description: Beginning with an aggressive argument in favour of flooding Lake Pedder this film, supporting the conservation of the lake, shows through the eyes of a photographer, botanist, artist, zoologist, poet and others, something of the beauty and interest residing in the lake and its surroundings.

results.title: Stuart Little (Collector's edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rob Minkoff, Jason Clark, Jeff Franklin II, Steve Waterman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: When his parents want to adopt another child, George Little begs them to bring him home a little brother, however he is surprised when they bring home a mouse who they name Stuart. George resents the intrusion into his family by a mouse, until a model boat race in Central Park draws the two brothers together. Unfortunately, the family cat Snowbell finds the temptation to eat the new family member unbearable and will not rest until Stuart is out of his life. Based on the story by E.B. White. Features the voices of Michael J. Fox, Nathan Lane, Jennifer Tilly and Bruno Kirby.

results.title: Struggle for oil
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the oil resources of the Canadian prairies and how their discovery is affecting the economy of the West. A gusher gone wild, oil crews working feverishly around the clock, oil barons conferring in plush board rooms, the Alberta pipeline, Edmonton’s neon nightlife - these are the glimpses the film shows of how oil is taking its place with agriculture, bringing a new industrial prosperity. Despite the inexhaustible appearance of Alberta’s oil wells, scientists are looking farther north, to the far sands of Athabaska where still greater deposits wait to be released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Dick, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Struck by lightning
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Domaradzki, Terry J. Charatsis, Trevor Farrant and Dark Horse Pictures
results.brief_description: Rennie, a middle-aged ex-teacher, now carer of people with Downs Syndrome, has come to believe that humane containment is all that can be hoped for. Pat Cannizzaro, a young idealistic social misfit, believes that intellectually disabled people have the right to full self-realisation through self-expression and social relationships. The film has been praised for its humanity and intelligence. It has also been condemned for its cynical recycling of stereotypes and failure to portray the real issues surrounding the treatment of the intellectually impaired. Cast includes Garry McDonald, Brian Vriends and Catherine McClements.

results.title: Woodwinds and Brass
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s Concert”.
At one of Ottawa’s Saturday concerts for children, the conductor, Eugene Kash, introduces the woodwind and brass instruments and has musicians play each of the main types. Beginning with a willow whistle, he explains that modern wind instruments - flute, clarinet, trombone and others - are just more complex versions of this simple pipe.
